channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14946] Don't allow multi's to over run the max result size.
item.description:
If a user puts a list of tons of different gets into a table we will then send them along in a multi. The server un-wraps each get in the multi. While no single get may be over the size limit the total might be.

We should protect the server from this.
We should batch up on the server side so each RPC is smaller.
item.summary: Don't allow multi's to over run the max result size.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Marking critical since it's possible for a user to cause a Full GC on a server without even meaning to.

How does something like this strike everyone.

It will create a multi action of up to 100 different requests. So most people shouldn't see a difference. However it shouldn't be possible to add thousands of requests to a single multi.

Also as a follow on we should have a server side safety valve on this.
So when we have 101 Actions for one region and 101 for another (in List<Get>), there will be 4 request with 100, 1, 100, 1 Actions in it?
Fixed that so that actions for different regions can be in the same request multi. Though I am not sure that we need it since I also added the total size calculations on the server side.
Patch without the client side change.

On commit change name of this method:

public void incrementCellSize(long cellSize) {

to incrementResponseCellSize

It is not important that it be accurate?

private long responseCellSize = 0;

Volatile? Or it don't matter? Or one thread only?

Add size to the message:

throw new HBaseIOException("Response size would be too large");

So, we are going to break the client response? How do they get the full response back? Needs admin intervention?

Why does the scanner chunking not help here?

This message is automatically generated.

It is not important that it be accurate?

Not 100% accurate. Just making sure to get an estimate of the size. If we're off by a byte here or there it's not a big deal.

Volatile? Or it don't matter? Or one thread only?

One thread only.

throw new HBaseIOException("Response size would be too large");

Can do.

So, we are going to break the client response? How do they get the full response back? Needs admin intervention?

The async process should retry all failed gets. Let me get a test to show that.

Why does the scanner chunking not help here?

Multi actions won't contain scans. And we don't chunk on anything where is isGetScan is true.

The basic flow is like this.

I want to get a single column from lots of rows. So I create a list of gets. Then I send them to table.get(List<Get>). If the regions for that table are spread out then those requests get chunked out to all the region servers. No one regionserver gets too many. However if one region server contains lots of regions for that table then a multi action can contain lots of gets. No single get is too onerous. However the regionserver won't return until every get is complete. So if there are thousands of gets that are sent in one multi then the regionserver can retain lots of data in one thread.

So I wrote the test and it took a while because the client was doing exponential back off when it saw the exception. So I'm going to wire up a special exception that will mean don't increase the backoff time.
Gary Helmling brought up that this could break users of older clients who were ok asking for very large gets. So this is a little larger than it was before.
https://reviews.facebook.net/D51771

[ERROR] /Users/misty/hbase/hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/ReplicationStateZKBase.java:[84,34] cannot find symbol

  symbol:   method getZooKeeperClusterKey(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration)

If I go to the commit before that one (cff664c5e286bebaddd93665680fb148783b8e7a), the build works.

Misty Stanley-Jones This jira didn't touch that file at all. Also I'm able to mvn package -DskipTests on master

mvn compile has never worked well since anything that's cross module pulls from the .m2 cache.
Wacky. You are right, it seems to work now. Maybe I was forgetting to run mvn clean .... sorry for the false alarm.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
The HBase region server will now send a chunk of get responses to a client if the total response size is too large. This will only be done for clients 1.2.0 and beyond. Older clients by default will have the old behavior.

This patch is for the case where the basic flow is like this:

I want to get a single column from lots of rows. So I create a list of gets. Then I send them to table.get(List<Get>). If the regions for that table are spread out then those requests get chunked out to all the region servers. No one regionserver gets too many. However if one region server contains lots of regions for that table then a multi action can contain lots of gets. No single get is too onerous. However the regionserver won't return until every get is complete. So if there are thousands of gets that are sent in one multi then the regionserver can retain lots of data in one thread.
